solution_line_template: Bess throws the Frisbee out {bess_throws} times * {bess_distance_per_throw} meters each time = <<{bess_throws}*{bess_distance_per_throw}={bess_out_distance}>>{bess_out_distance} meters.

She then throws it back which doubles the distance traveled to {bess_out_distance} meters * {bess_return_multiplier} = <<{bess_out_distance}*{bess_return_multiplier}={bess_total_distance}>>{bess_total_distance} meters.
Holly throws the Frisbee out {holly_throws} times * {holly_distance_per_throw} meters = <<{holly_throws}*{holly_distance_per_throw}={holly_total_distance}>>{holly_total_distance} meters.
So in total, Holly and Bess have thrown the Frisbees {bess_total_distance} + {holly_total_distance} = <<{bess_total_distance}+{holly_total_distance}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} meters.
